intro: Psychotria stipulosa, commonly known as the "stipule psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with prominent stipules at the base of each leaf pair. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
